Package com.github.actionfx.core.view

Class AbstractView

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.actionfx.core.view.AbstractView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    View
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FxmlView, ParentView
    public abstract class AbstractView
extends java.lang.Object
implements View
    Abstract base class for view implementations.
    Author:
    koster

      • getRootNode

        public <T> T getRootNode()
        Description copied from interface: View
        Returns the root node of the view. The returned type is generic, because not all nodes of the scene graph do inherit from Node - e.g. tabs of type Tab inside a TabPane. However, in most of the cases, FXML views are based on view components based on type Node.
        Specified by:
        getRootNode in interface View
        Returns:
        the root node of the view

      • attachViewToParent

        public void attachViewToParent​(javafx.scene.Parent parent,
                               NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher attacher)
        Description copied from interface: View
        Attaches this view as child to the supplied parent, using the given NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher. This method can be used to compose a larger view out of multiple smaller views. An alternative use case could be to implement a "docking" functionality, together with method View.detachView() as the "undocking" operation.
        Specified by:
        attachViewToParent in interface View
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent to attach this view to
        attacher - the NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher that defines the strategy, how to attach the view to a node

      • detachView

        public void detachView()
        Description copied from interface: View
        Detaches this view from the view node's parent.
        Specified by:
        detachView in interface View

      • getWindow

        public javafx.stage.Window getWindow()
        Description copied from interface: View
        Gets the Window where this view is currently displayed in. In case the view has not yet been displayed, null is returned.
        Specified by:
        getWindow in interface View
        Returns:
        the Window in that this view is displayed, or null, in case the view has not yet been displayed.

      • getScene

        public javafx.scene.Scene getScene()
        Description copied from interface: View
        Gets the Scene that this view is part of. In case the view has not yet been added to a scene, null is returned.
        Specified by:
        getScene in interface View
        Returns:
        the Scene that this view is part of, or null, in case the view has not been added to a scene.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the retrieved node, or null, in case there is no node with the given nodeId
